Date Published: August 24, 2020   |   Author: Sophie Su   |   Length: 373 Words

Application Analytic and Support Internship

In the summer of 2019, I have had the incredible opportunity to intern abroad at Orient Securities located south of China. Orient Securities is an investment bank and brokerage firm providing securities, futures, asset management, investment banking, and securities research. Working as a data analyst intern at the company has allowed me to utilize MySQL, data modeling, and statistical skills to archive tasks assigned to me. I was responsible for resolving client issues (application-related), producing weekly reports, and accommodating internal requests with proper documentation. Personally, I had a passion for business ever since high school when I started stock investment, it was very exciting for me to learn and work at a financial institution. Interestingly, not only did this internship enable me to grow professionally in the field of computing but also as an investor as I work with financial counselors.



Our team is responsible for maintaining the Orient Securities stock trading application. My manager believes that I should know the business before kicking into software maintenance. My intern begins shadowing under our financial counselor to learn the service style, customer expectation, and company value that we engage in the everyday business. Once I became familiar with the business, I soon begin utilizing our ticketing system to assist clients with application-related problems. These may be installing, upgrading, and configuring the application for new users, running software diagnostic, and repairing software issues on the client end-device. Every so often, errors are due to mismatched database information requiring us to modify the database through SQL queries (verified by the manager before committing onto the database).


Software maintenance comes to be very client-oriented. Due to its managerial and technical nature, we must identify the user expectation throughout the maintenance cycle. My role was to generate weekly analytical reports that summarizes application statistics including client feedback, satisfaction score, and tickets resolved during the week. Reports capture client preferred way of communication, their operating systems, access device, notification preference, marketing statistics, login activities, screen time, and client usage data. These are reported in graphical forms such as tables and charts and updated onto our web dashboard for other departments to track sale progress. Finally, analyzing these data helps us bridge the business gap with opportunities for app improvement.
